meanings.definition: To make or become Japanese in character or style.
meanings.sent1: She tried to japanize her artwork by using traditional Japanese motifs.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant decided to japanize its menu by adding sushi and ramen dishes.
meanings.sent3: He attempted to japanize his wardrobe by wearing a kimono to work.
meanings.sent4: The garden was japanized with the addition of a serene koi pond.
meanings.sent5: The room was japanized with paper lanterns and bamboo decorations.

meanings.definition: To adapt or conform to Japanese customs or practices.
meanings.sent1: The foreign exchange student had to japanize her manners to fit in with her host family.
meanings.sent2: The company had to japanize its business etiquette when dealing with Japanese clients.
meanings.sent3: He tried to japanize his greeting by bowing instead of shaking hands.
meanings.sent4: The school curriculum was japanized to include more lessons on Japanese history.
meanings.sent5: The festival was japanized with traditional Japanese performances and food stalls.
